title: How to Make a Balinese Spice Paste

steps.headline: Peel your shallots, garlic and clean your chillies.
Process these with all other ingredients in a food processor until fairly well blended - not smooth however, you want some texture, but really nothing coarser than a peppercorn size.
Or if you are feeling very energetic, crush in a mortar and pestle.
steps.description: This might take about 30 minutes though.

steps.headline: Heat a frying pan with about 2 tablespoons of peanut oil.
steps.description: When hot, add the paste and fry until golden - about 2 minutes. Enjoy the smell - It smells lovely.

steps.description: You can also add it to curries and braises.

text: Peel your shallots, garlic and clean your chillies.  Process these with all other ingredients in a food processor until fairly well blended - not smooth however, you want some texture, but really nothing coarser than a peppercorn size.  Or if you are feeling very energetic, crush in a mortar and pestle. This might take about 30 minutes though. Heat a frying pan with about 2 tablespoons of peanut oil. When hot, add the paste and fry until golden - about 2 minutes. Enjoy the smell - It smells lovely. Allow to cool and then use about 1/2 a cup to 600g of meat as a marinade, or mixing it into to minced meats (about the same weight) or coating a whole chicken for a BBQ. You can also add it to curries and braises. Freeze your surplus spice mix and wash all utensils as quickly as possible to reduce turmeric staining.  Enjoy!  Finished.
